fields.name: User Guide
fields.description: Comprehensive guide for using the Yakkum platform

fields.title: Getting Started with Yakkum
fields.summary: Learn the basics of navigating and using the Yakkum mental health service directory platform.
fields.content:
# Getting Started with Yakkum

## Introduction

Welcome to Yakkum! This guide will help you get started with our mental health service directory platform.

## Dashboard Overview

The dashboard provides an overview of:
- Key indicators and statistics
- Recent submissions
- Verification queue
- Service distribution map

## Navigation

Use the sidebar to access:
- Dashboard
- Services Management
- Survey Management
- Verification & QC
- User Management
- System Settings
- Reports & Analytics
- Logs & Monitoring
- Help & Documentation

## Next Steps

1. Familiarize yourself with the dashboard
2. Learn about service management
3. Understand the verification process
4. Explore reporting capabilities

fields.title: Managing Services
fields.summary: Learn how to add, edit, and manage mental health services in the directory.
fields.content:
# Managing Services

## Adding a New Service

1. Navigate to **Services Management** > **Add New Service**
2. Fill in the required information:
   - Service name
   - Location and address
   - Contact information
   - Service types (MTC/BSIC)
   - Operating hours
   - Available resources

## Editing Services

1. Go to **Services Management** > **All Services**
2. Click on the service you want to edit
3. Make your changes
4. Click **Save**

## Service Categories

### Main Types of Care (MTC)
- Residential care
- Day care
- Outpatient care
- Accessibility
- Information
- Work and training
- Self-help and voluntary work

### Basic Service Identification Codes (BSIC)
Detailed classification of services based on DESDE-LTC standards.

fields.title: Understanding DESDE-LTC Classification
fields.summary: Comprehensive guide to the DESDE-LTC (Description and Evaluation of Services and DirectoriEs for Long Term Care) classification system.
fields.content:
# DESDE-LTC Classification System

## Overview

DESDE-LTC is a standardized instrument for describing and classifying services for mental health and long-term care.

## Main Types of Care (MTC)

### R - Residential Care
Services providing accommodation and 24-hour care.

### D - Day Care
Services providing structured daytime activities.

### O - Outpatient Care
Services providing scheduled consultations and treatments.

### A - Accessibility to Care
Services facilitating access to care.

### I - Information
Services providing information about available care.

### W - Work and Training
Services for vocational rehabilitation.

### S - Self-help and Voluntary Work
User-led and peer support services.

## Classification Codes

Each service is assigned a code like R2.1, D3.2, etc.
- First letter: Main type of care
- Number after dot: Specific service type

For detailed classification, refer to the official DESDE-LTC manual.

fields.title: Enumerator Quick Reference Guide
fields.summary: Quick reference guide for enumerators conducting mental health service surveys.
fields.content:
# Enumerator Quick Reference Guide

## Before Starting

- [ ] Review the survey form
- [ ] Prepare necessary documents
- [ ] Charge your device
- [ ] Test internet connection

## During the Survey

### 1. Introduction
- Introduce yourself
- Explain the purpose
- Request consent

### 2. Data Collection
- Follow the survey flow
- Ask clarifying questions
- Document evidence (photos, documents)
- Verify information

### 3. Service Details
- Name and location
- Contact information
- Services provided (MTC/BSIC)
- Operating hours
- Available resources
- Target populations

### 4. Quality Checks
- Verify GPS coordinates
- Check contact details
- Validate service classifications
- Ensure all required fields are complete

## After the Survey

- Submit the survey
- Upload supporting documents
- Note any issues or concerns
- Follow up if additional information is needed

## Common Issues

### GPS Not Working
- Enable location services
- Move to an open area
- Manually enter coordinates

### Service Not in Database
- Add as new service
- Use Add New Service form
- Provide detailed information

### Respondent Unavailable
- Schedule a callback
- Leave contact information
- Document the attempt

fields.question: How do I reset my password?
fields.answer:
To reset your password:

1. Click on Forgot Password on the login page
2. Enter your email address
3. Check your email for a reset link
4. Click the link and enter your new password

If you don't receive the email within 5 minutes, check your spam folder or contact support.

fields.question: What are the different user roles?
fields.answer:
Yakkum has several user roles:

**Administrator**: Full system access, can manage all users and settings

**Data Manager**: Can manage services, surveys, and perform verification

**Verifier**: Can verify and approve/reject survey submissions

**Enumerator**: Can submit surveys and manage own submissions

**Viewer**: Read-only access to view data and reports

fields.question: How do I classify a service using DESDE-LTC?
fields.answer:
To classify a service:

1. Identify the **Main Type of Care (MTC)**:
   - R: Residential
   - D: Day care
   - O: Outpatient
   - A: Accessibility
   - I: Information
   - W: Work/training
   - S: Self-help

2. Determine the **specific service type** using the BSIC code

3. Combine them (e.g., R2.1 for psychiatric hospital)

Refer to the DESDE-LTC Reference guide for detailed codes.

fields.question: How long does the verification process take?
fields.answer:
The verification process typically takes:

- **Standard submissions**: 2-3 business days
- **Complex submissions**: 5-7 business days
- **Submissions with issues**: Until issues are resolved

You'll receive email notifications about the status of your submission.

fields.question: Can I export data from the system?
fields.answer:
Yes! You can export data in several formats:

**Available formats**:
- PDF reports
- Excel spreadsheets (.xlsx)
- CSV files

**To export**:
1. Navigate to the data you want to export
2. Click the Export button
3. Select your preferred format
4. Choose the data range and filters
5. Click Download

Export permissions depend on your user role.
